profileText: A Representative from Mississippi; born in Yazoo City, Miss., November 30, 1953; B.A., Howard University, Washington, D.C., 1975; J.D., University of Santa Clara Law School, California, 1978; attorney with Central Mississippi Legal Services, 1978-1980; assistant secretary of state, chief, Mississippi Legal Services, 1978-1980; assistant secretary of Public Lands Division, 1980-1984; assistant State attorney general, 1984-1985; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundredth and to the three succeeding Congresses and served from January 3, 1987, until his resignation January 22, 1993, having been appointed Secretary of Agriculture in the Cabinet of President William J. Clinton; Secretary of Agriculture, 1993-1994; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate in 2018 and in 2020.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Alphonso Michael (Mike) Espy" in Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2008.

researchRecord.name: 1986-1988, 19 commercials on 4 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials used during Mike Espy's campaigns for the 1986 and 1988 U.S. congressional elections in District 2 of Mississippi, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: ca. 1987-1994, 100 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The collection includes papers, publications, photographs, and memorabilia documenting Mike Espy's tenure on the following House committees: Agriculture, Budget, and Select Committee on Hunger. The collection is closed pending processing.
